intro: Lepidaploa densipaniculata, commonly known as the dense panicle lepidaploa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, branched inflorescences that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate habitats and is found in parts of Asia. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and the flowers are small and white or greenish in color. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
